Subject: Using junit with extensions that inherit from TestCase - how to do?

Hello,

I'm attempting to use MockRunner with JUnit 3.8.1. The test classes=

using MockRunner extend from MockRunner's BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter
rather =
than JUnit's TestCase (although BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter itself
extends Tes=
tCase). When I run the tests at the command line

"C:\Program Files\Java\jr=
e1.5.0_06\bin\javaw.exe" -cp
.;E:\software\development\junit3.8.1\junit.jar=
 junit.awtui.TestRunner
BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter test.testResultSet2ArrayLi=
st

the TestRunner GUI starts but states "Load Test Case..." at the bottom
=
and does nothing else.

To make sure the problem was with BasicJDBCTestCase=
Adapter, I
commented out the test class' body and executed the tests again.=
 The
same result occured. However, when I replace BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter
=
with TestCase (and modify the imports accordingly) TestRunner gives me
a "n=
o tests found" failure notice. Therefore, I'm pretty sure that
TestRunner i=
s not recognizing BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter as a testable
class.

To put my =
question in a general sense, how can TestRunner recognize
class A that exte=
nds class B that extends TestCase as testable?
